instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: This board ran on battery but had no green light. Found corrosion around <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR> and that edge of the board and had .7V at SMC BC ACOK. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR> and got green light and PPBUS G3H and short fan spin but stops... PPBUS G3H stays steady at 12.62V once connected to power and after fan starts and stops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: Does it start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: It DOES. Never used that to test before... what does that imply? AFter poking around the posts a bit... being it runs ok on battery does this mean then that SMC current sensing related to the charging circuit is awry?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Most likely.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
85w Charger only  connected:
17/18 resistance 3.0 ohms 
27/28 20.9 ohms
dCIN VSENSE 2.8V
PBUS VSENSE 2.1V
DCIN ISENSE 0V
BMON ISENSE 3.4V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
"BMON ISENSE 3.4V"
Too high value; post <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: damnit I must've tested wrong spot before for <SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> its 0V. OY! sorry

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Aaaah, you get short fan spin in normal mode.
Then must be a SMC sensor from other rail.
Check all other sensor circuits from pages 49/50.
I bet for some corroded trace, or resistor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: being that it runs on battery that would mean problem in related to the DCIN sensors right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Shouldn't be DCIN sensor, as it tries to start in normal mode.
DCIN and PBUS sensors look good also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: lost a pad on the smc trying to reball it. DOn't have another 2936 board! I'll have to put this one on the shelf until I get a SMC for it. I was thinking it had to be SMC related being the battery op runs fine and charger sensors seem to be reading correctly? Idk. I couldn't identify any sensor issues related to the pages you referenced but I'll try again once I get SMC back on it.
